title: AUR installing error
body:
- **OS version and name**: 

```zsh
$ cat /etc/os-release
NAME="Arch Linux"
PRETTY_NAME="Arch Linux"
ID=arch
BUILD_ID=rolling
ANSI_COLOR="0;36"
HOME_URL="https://www.archlinux.org/"
DOCUMENTATION_URL="https://wiki.archlinux.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://bbs.archlinux.org/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.archlinux.org/"
LOGO=archlinux

$ uname -r
5.5.2-arch1-1
```

- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2-1

I have installed [asdf-vm](https://github.com/asdf-vm/asdf) version manager. Maybe this is the cause of the error?

```zsh
$ which python 
/home/sergey/.asdf/shims/python

$ which python2
/home/sergey/.asdf/shims/python2

$ which node   
/home/sergey/.asdf/shims/node

$ ls /usr/bin/pyt*
/usr/bin/python   /usr/bin/python2.7         /usr/bin/python2-config  /usr/bin/python3.8         /usr/bin/python3-config
/usr/bin/python2  /usr/bin/python2.7-config  /usr/bin/python3         /usr/bin/python3.8-config  /usr/bin/python-config

title: Cannot scroll in vim
body:
Cannot scroll in vim for files longer than 1 page. it works when using specific themes such as `hyperterm-gotham` but unable to scroll in any other themes
Using:
`zsh 5.4.2 (x86_64-ubuntu-linux-gnu)`
`antigen (latest)`
`hyperterm 3.0.2 on WSL (Windows10)`

title: MOSH's escape keyboard shortcut (ctrl+^) not worked
body:
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

- **OS version and name**: macOS 10.15.3
- **Hyper.app version**:  3.0.2 (stable)
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: `Is Vanilla`

## Issue
In MOSH (https://mosh.mit.edu/) for exit I am need to input `ctrl+^` (actually for this I am pressed keys `ctrl`, `shift`, `6`).

From MOSH manual:
```
ESCAPE SEQUENCES
       The  default  escape  character used by Mosh is ASCII RS (decimal 30).  
       This is typically typed as Ctrl-^ or Ctrl-Shift-6, on US English keyboards.  
```

In Chrome this combination catched by event `keypress` like this (key code === 30):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1515699/74217626-94b9af80-4cda-11ea-8863-23e941ce4b2d.png)

In `Hyper` this combination not worked.
In `iTerm` and native terminal app - this combination worked.

## How to reproduce:
1. In `Hyper` connect to linux which have command `showkey` (I am use debian) and run
```
showkey -a
```
and then press `ctrl`, '`shift`, `6` - nothing was happends.
2. In other terminal do same - and you will see:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1515699/74218077-dac34300-4cdb-11ea-8eaa-dd496bc06006.png)


Thank you for you work!

title: clearBuffer when prompt have a line break
body:
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: macOS Catalina 10.15.3
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2 (stable)
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/crtlf/503a1fe59032cda1c526caeebf3f273a

## Issue

I'm using the [Spaceship prompt](https://github.com/denysdovhan/spaceship-prompt) plugin.
By default, the prompt add a line break that displays the prompt in two separate lines.

As you can see in the video below, when using the `clearBuffer` keymap (`Command + K` by default), it clears to the second line of the prompt.
![Enregistrement de l’écran 2020-02-07 à 09 55 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6808395/74015349-b9d3b880-4990-11ea-994d-ce1af5cf74dd.gif)

Is there a way to tell Hyper to clear showing the 2 last lines instead of only the last one ?

**PS :**  The `clear` command works as expected though. It's doing it only for the Hyper keymap.

title: Unable to Open Hyper on CentOS
body:
<!--
  Hi there! Thank you for discovering and submitting an issue.

  Before you submit this; let's make sure of a few things.

  If not, please try and fulfill these first.
-->

- [ X ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3321, https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/2743 and https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/2861 look similar but not identical


<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,

-->

- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: <!-- Gist Link Here -->

- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: <!-- Replace with info if applicable, or `Is Vanilla`. (Vanilla means Hyper.app without any add-ons or extras. Straight out of the box.) --> 

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->

Successfully Installing Hyper.app by running `sudo yum install https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/download/3.0.2/hyper-3.0.2.x86_64.rpm`

However it will not open.

The following error is from `/var/log/messages`

```

title: Mouse pointer click position is incorrect when not showing caret
body:
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: macOS Catalina
- **Hyper.app version**: Hyper 3.0.1-canary.4 (canary)
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/peppy/b0bacddcdf3fef7fe49ba4ed4a04939c
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/a
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: Yes

## Issue

When an application that supports mouse selection chooses to display the cursor in pointer mode (instead of caret), the point of selection is not at the tip of the pointer but instead at the centre of the pointer image.

The application I've been seeing this happen in is `lazygit`, but it should apply to any terminal app which uses mouse reporting and cursor type changing.

I've cross-checked with iTerm and confirmed that it is not an issue there.

title: #config-location Either your webpage is wrong or your program.

labels.name: 📖 Documentation
labels.description: Issue pertains to documentation of Hyper

body:
- [x] Your Hyper.app version is **3.0.2**. Please verify your using the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate --- - **Any relevant information from devtools?** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/A - **Is the issue reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app?** Yes. ## Issue Either your webpage is wrong or your program. [hyper.is/#config-location](https://hyper.is/#config-location) says for macOS the path to config file is `~/Library/Application Support/Hyper/.hyper.js` and it says “config at `~/.hyper.js` still supported”. But when I start a freshly installed Hyper.app it creates `~/Lib…/App…Supp…/Hyper/` without `.hyper.js` and `.hyper_plugins/` inside but creates `~/.hyper.js` and `~/.hyper_plugins/`. Even when I move them from my home dir to Hyper’s AppSupport dir. They are re-created. - **Hyper version**: undefined "3.0.2" - **OS ARCH VERSION:** darwin x64 17.7.0 - **Electron:** 3.1.3 **LANG:** undefined - **SHELL:** /bin/bash **TERM:** undefined

title: Cert Expired
body: @rauchg @timneutkens @juancampa the code signing cert in Appveyor CI expired.

title: Clear Buffer creating huge whitespace gaps on Windows.
body:
<!--
  Hi there! Thank you for discovering and submitting an issue.

  Before you submit this; let's make sure of a few things.
  Please make sure the following boxes are ticked if they are correct.
  If not, please try and fulfill these first.
-->

<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: Windows 10 Pro [Version 1909 (OS Build 18363.592)]
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2 Stable
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/zyxxyzyxz/494e4607155cf110fa83317e6d86f1ba
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/A

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->
EDIT:
I did type some stuff here but I managed to figure out what was causing it, so I'm editing.

It appears using `Clear Buffer` on Windows is causing huge whitespace gaps depending on the size of your previous buffer. 

For example, you can see below with a small-sized buffer it only skips 1-2 lines;
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22277786/73588365-5c101e00-4503-11ea-989d-0c3f99ac052d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22277786/73588367-629e9580-4503-11ea-87e7-131aec7a331d.png)

But with a larger buffer, it causes much bigger whitespace gaps as shown below;
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22277786/73588380-8feb4380-4503-11ea-95fd-8dbb7f54a6df.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22277786/73588384-9679bb00-4503-11ea-8097-9b0ba0d86947.png)

Hopefully this can be fixed.

title: Sending large text over ssh causes slow downs
body:
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: 10.15.2 (19C57)
- **Hyper.app version**: Hyper 3.0.2 (stable)
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: <!-- Replace with info if applicable, or `Is Vanilla`. (Vanilla means Hyper.app without any add-ons or extras. Straight out of the box.) --> Yes

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->
Pasting a large amount of text of SSH causes the window to become slower and slower until it completely stops responding. I've mainly been copying 170k files over via copy+paste as I use pbcopy on my Macbook to load the file in from an app I'm working with.

title: Terminal not visible after MacBook comes back from sleep
body:
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [X] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [X] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5039466/73470598-bcf5f580-434d-11ea-8765-2ecf7a723257.png)
Could be related to: https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3160 or https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3341

- **OS version and name**: MacOS 10.15.2 (19C57)
- **Hyper.app version**: Hyper 3.0.2 (stable)
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/dbhagen/853571c4b583216b3e8461ab9da75c7f
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: 
```
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'isWrapped' of undefined
    at Buffer._reflowSmaller (bundle.js:1)
    at Buffer._reflow (bundle.js:1)
    at Buffer.resize (bundle.js:1)
    at BufferSet.resize (bundle.js:1)
    at Terminal.resize (bundle.js:1)
    at Terminal.resize (bundle.js:1)
    at fit (bundle.js:1)
    at Terminal.e.fit (bundle.js:1)
    at Term.fitResize (bundle.js:1)
    at resizeTimeout.resizeTimeout.setTimeout (bundle.js:1)
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5039466/73470843-1fe78c80-434e-11ea-8b1c-568aeb3f4e6d.png)

- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: No. It seems to be related to a combo of my add-ons, though I've tried disabling them in sequence to determine which could be causing it. 

## Issue
So I have a new MacBook Pro 16", and have turned off graphics switching on it. Occasionally when I close my MacBook for an extended amount of time and open it back up, my Terminal Windows and Tabs are blank:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5039466/73471204-984e4d80-434e-11ea-9c83-4c7d3e149407.png)
I can create a new window or tab and the terminal is there. I lose my history, which is annoying.

Attaching power settings on Mac:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5039466/73471140-82d92380-434e-11ea-8fa0-2da93918f299.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5039466/73471156-866caa80-434e-11ea-86e3-9eda1a3f85d5.png)

title: Watch screen rewrite
body:
- **OS version and name**: Catalina 10.15.2
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/cdenneen/6616becee15916e04a5d9b688a7e91e1

## Issue
Running command via watch. Switch tab. Go back to watch tab. You must CTRL-C and re-run to see output. 

I've tried to disable webgl rendering but didn't help.
I've removed all plugins but didn't help.

title: Using win-bash as a shell
body:
<!--
  Hi there! Thank you for discovering and submitting an issue.

  Before you submit this; let's make sure of a few things.
  Please make sure the following boxes are ticked if they are correct.
  If not, please try and fulfill these first.
-->

<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x ] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: Windows 10 latest build
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2 stable
- **Link of my [.hyper.js](https://gist.github.com/lrnv/d91af3b65399b23b9df2a432d89e7519)

- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: Is vanilla

## Issue
Hi, 

I'm trying to run bash on windows, using the win-bash port from [here](http://win-bash.sourceforge.net/). This is an old port, but this is a **native** bash. Running the bash.exe by myself works fine and gives me a terminal. BUT setting the bash.exe into my .hyper.js file does not. 

How can i make this work ? The relevant part of my hyper.js is here : 

`  shell: 'C:\\Program Files\\win-bash\\bash.exe'`

title: Cursor does not appear in 3.10-canary.1
body:
<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: macOS Catalina 10.15.2
- **Hyper.app version**:  3.1.0-canary.1 (canary)
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/mbentley/80d63c46f59a743326ed2afd298a7fc0
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: n/a
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**:  yes

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->
When upgrading from the latest stable to the latest canary, the cursor no longer shows up on the screen .  I removed my `.hyper.js` to let it generate a new config and it still doesn't show up.  Reverting back to the stable channel fixes that.

I did some playing around with my config and if I use a hex color, it shows up.  If I use a RBGA color, it either disappears or only appears if it is over text.

Cursor with `cursorColor: 'rgba(78,77,0,0.8)',` and my cursor is over the `n` in missing
![screenshot 2020-01-22 at 3 44 30 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/414445/72932622-219dc880-3d2e-11ea-873b-0ce789503672.png)

Looking fine with a hex value:
![screenshot 2020-01-22 at 3 47 52 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/414445/72932866-940ea880-3d2e-11ea-9887-6c08da9662ee.png)

title: Hyper breaks $PATH if path contains unicode
body:
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

- **OS version and name**: Windows
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: Irrevalant
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/A
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: Is Vanilla

## Issue
When Hyper append its own path on the PATH environment variable, it replaces the unicode characters in the path with question mark or �.

The path of the Hyper is unaffected, but this affects all other paths in $PATH.

title: fresh install of hyper produces nice glitch art
body: - [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version - [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate - **OS version and name**: OS X El Capitan v10.11.6 - **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2 (stable) - **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: N/A - **Relevant information from devtools**: - **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: Yes ## Issue I've had hyper on my system for some years but haven't used it in over a year. I decided to give it another try and when I opened saw the notification at the bottom to automatically update to 3.0.2. I clicked restart, and now Hyper shows some nice colorful glitches. It's quite pretty. I thought it may have been an issue with my plugins, so I decided to just delete all the hyper stuff I had in user home folder including anything starting with `.hyper` (looks like user home is no longer the place it should be anyway). Also deleted hyper.app from applications just in case and decided to download fresh. Same issue: I'm really hoping this isn't a case of not being compatible with my OS. Thanks!

title: Hyper Canary + neovim true color = lag
body:
<!--
  Hi there! Thank you for discovering and submitting an issue.

  Before you submit this; let's make sure of a few things.
  Please make sure the following boxes are ticked if they are correct.
  If not, please try and fulfill these first.

- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: Windows 10 Pro Version 10.0.18362 Build 18362
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.1.0-canary.1 (stable)
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/mpcsh/369248d0dde3c452f7b58e8a4115488d) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: <!-- Gist Link Here -->
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/A<!-- Replace with info if applicable, or N/A -->
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: Yes<!-- Replace with info if applicable, or `Is Vanilla`. (Vanilla means Hyper.app without any add-ons or extras. Straight out of the box.) -->

## Issue
<!-- Now feel free to write your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->
I decided to check out the canary build to see if true color was working, which it looks like it is! Unfortunately, if I use vim with `termguicolors` enabled, I get big time lag. If I run `:set notermguicolors`, it's back to normal, just like that.

title: SSH key based authentication against remote server, how does it work?
body:
- [x] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

- **OS version and name**: Ubuntu 18.04 LTE
- **Hyper.app version**: none yet
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: not existing yet 
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: N/A
- **The issue is reproducible in vanilla Hyper.app**: N/A

## Issue

Hi there,
I cannot find any documentation so I try it that way. The only information close is
- https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3100
- https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3950
- https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/1375
- https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/3279
- https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/2373 

and in https://hyper.is/#cfg:

> defaultSSHApp | true | If true, Hyper will be set as the default protocol client for SSH
> -- | -- | --

How is SSH key based authenticitation against a remote server realized?. Reading through limited information available leads to the impression that is possible but how?   
I want to realize [SSH Agent Forwarding](http://www.unixwiz.net/techtips/ssh-agent-forwarding.html). 
In the case of Ubuntu, my guess is to tell hyper to use [Ubuntu Manpage: ssh — OpenSSH SSH client (remote login program)](https://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/cosmic/en/man1/ssh.1.html) ([How To Use SSH to Connect to a Remote Server in Ubuntu](https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-use-ssh-to-connect-to-a-remote-server-in-ubuntu))
with a reference to the config file for a dedicated session, isn't it

title: This solution fixed it for me.
body:
This solution fixed it for me.
https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues/2144#issuecomment-326741620

Go to `about hyper` to check the render engine.

Thanks, again! -->

title: Electron error when building for Aarch64 on Raspberry Pi
body:
- [x ] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [ x] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate



- **Raspbian 10 (buster)** (64-bit mode): 
- **Canary**: 

## Issue
I am trying to get Hyper working on the Raspberry Pi.  This is a feature people have been asking for for years now.  Trying to run `yarn run app` gives the error 
```
yarn run v1.21.1
$ electron target
/home/pi/Downloads/hyper/node_modules/electron/index.js:14
    throw new Error('Electron failed to install correctly, please delete node_modules/electron and try installing again')
    ^

Error: Electron failed to install correctly, please delete node_modules/electron and try installing again

    at Module._compile (internal/modules/cjs/loader.js:1139:30)
error Command failed with exit code 1.
info Visit https://yarnpkg.com/en/docs/cli/run for documentation about this command.
```

Specifically,
**Error: Electron failed to install correctly, please delete node_modules/electron and try installing again**

I have attempted to do this—many times—to no avail.  Even though I can get electron installed independently with `npm install -g electron@6`

title: Extra right padding when using vim
body:
<!--
  Hi there! Thank you for discovering and submitting an issue.

  Before you submit this; let's make sure of a few things.
  Please make sure the following boxes are ticked if they are correct.
  If not, please try and fulfill these first.
-->

<!-- Checked checkbox should look like this: [x] -->
- [ x ] I am on the [latest](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/releases/latest) Hyper.app version
- [ x ] I have searched the [issues](https://github.com/zeit/hyper/issues) of this repo and believe that this is not a duplicate

<!--
  Once those are done, if you're able to fill in the following list with your information,
  it'd be very helpful to whoever handles the issue.
-->

- **OS version and name**: Ubuntu 19.10<!-- Replace with version + name -->
- **Hyper.app version**: 3.0.2 <!-- Replace with version -->
- **Link of a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/) with the contents of your .hyper.js**: https://gist.github.com/diovanii/17336b78dfd62209283be66bbd26d8e6<!-- Gist Link Here -->
- **Relevant information from devtools** _(CMD+ALT+I on macOS, CTRL+SHIFT+I elsewhere)_: <!-- Replace with info if applicable, or N/A -->
- **When i start Neovim hyper adds a right padding to the window**: <!-- Replace with info if applicable, or `Is Vanilla`. (Vanilla means Hyper.app without any add-ons or extras. Straight out of the box.) -->

## Issue
When i start Neovim from Hyper it adds a right padding to the window (even if padding is set to 0)

![print](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47093916/71755882-9f775e00-2e6b-11ea-8996-71e35ab12adf.png)
